alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Western Franklin; Western Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 6:16PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Hampshire and central Franklin Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 616 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ashfield, or 11 miles southwest of Greenfield, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... Greenfield, Orange, Deerfield, Montague, Sunderland, Northfield, Williamsburg, Bernardston, Buckland, Conway, Shelburne, Leverett, Erving, Shutesbury, Ashfield, Colrain, Gill, Whately, Chesterfield and Goshen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for western Massachusetts.
